width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29572&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29572\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29572&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/MISP/MISP/commit/0bfc0bf38a7758b27c5c446fec5e3b905e5a54ab\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mitsubishielectric -- gt2107-wtbd_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Out-of-bounds read issue in GT21 model of GOT2000 series (GT2107-WTBD all versions, GT2107-WTSD all versions, GT2104-RTBD all versions, GT2104-PMBD all versions, and GT2103-PMBD all versions), GS21 model of GOT series (GS2110-WTBD all versions and GS2107-WTBD all versions), and Tension Controller LE7-40GU-L all versions allows a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition by sending a specially crafted packet. As a result, deterioration of communication performance or a denial-of-service (DoS) condition of the TCP communication functions of the products may occur.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-5675&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5675\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5675&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://jvn.jp/vu/JVNVU99277775/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mitsubishielectric.co.jp/psirt/vulnerability/pdf/2020-017.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mitsubishielectric.com/en/psirt/vulnerability/pdf/2020-017_en.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;moodle -- moodle&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability was found in Moodle where users with \"Log in as\" capability in a course context (typically, course managers) may gain access to some site administration capabilities by \"logging in as\" a System manager. This affects 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions. This is fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25629&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25629\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25629&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410841\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;moodle -- moodle&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability was found in Moodle where the decompressed size of zip files was not checked against available user quota before unzipping them, which could lead to a denial of service risk. This affects versions 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions. Fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25630&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25630\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25630&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410842\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;moodle -- moodle&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability was found in Moodle 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4 and 3.7 to 3.7.7 where it was possible to include JavaScript in a book's chapter title, which was not escaped on the \"Add new chapter\" page. This is fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5 and 3.7.8.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25631&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25631\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25631&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410843\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;moodle -- moodle&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The moodlenetprofile user profile field required extra sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk. This affects versions 3.9 to 3.9.1. Fixed in 3.9.2.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25627&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25627\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25627&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410839\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;moodle -- moodle&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The filter in the tag manager required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk. This affects 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions. Fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25628&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25628\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25628&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&amp;amp;a=search&amp;amp;h=HEAD&amp;amp;st=commit&amp;amp;s=MDL-69340\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410840\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Searching for a single word from the address bar caused an mDNS request to be sent on the local network searching for a hostname consisting of that string; resulting in an information leak. *Note: This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26966&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26966\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26966&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1663571\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Some websites have a feature \"Show Password\" where clicking a button will change a password field into a textbook field, revealing the typed password. If, when using a software keyboard that remembers user input, a user typed their password and used that feature, the type of the password field was changed, resulting in a keyboard layout change and the possibility for the software keyboard to remember the typed password. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26965&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26965\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26965&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1661617\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;OneCRL was non-functional in the new Firefox for Android due to a missing service initialization. This could result in a failure to enforce some certificate revocations. *Note: This issue only affected Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26957&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26957\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26957&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1667179\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Repeated calls to the history and location interfaces could have been used to hang the browser. This was addressed by introducing rate-limiting to these API calls. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26963&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26963\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26963&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1314912\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross-origin iframes that contained a login form could have been recognized by the login autofill service, and populated. This could have been used in clickjacking attacks, as well as be read across partitions in dynamic first party isolation. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26962&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26962\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26962&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=610997\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;When DNS over HTTPS is in use, it intentionally filters RFC1918 and related IP ranges from the responses as these do not make sense coming from a DoH resolver. However when an IPv4 address was mapped through IPv6, these addresses were erroneously let through, leading to a potential DNS Rebinding attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26961&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26961\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26961&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1672528\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Firefox did not block execution of scripts with incorrect MIME types when the response was intercepted and cached through a ServiceWorker. This could lead to a cross-site script inclusion vulnerability, or a Content Security Policy bypass. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26958&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26958\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26958&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1669355\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In some cases, removing HTML elements during sanitization would keep existing SVG event handlers and therefore lead to XSS. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26956&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26956\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26956&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1666300\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;When a user downloaded a file in Firefox for Android, if a cookie is set, it would have been re-sent during a subsequent file download operation on the same domain, regardless of whether the original and subsequent request were in private and non-private browsing modes. *Note: This issue only affected Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26955&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26955\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26955&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1663261\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;When accepting a malicious intent from other installed apps, Firefox for Android accepted manifests from arbitrary file paths and allowed declaring webapp manifests for other origins. This could be used to gain fullscreen access for UI spoofing and could also lead to cross-origin attacks on targeted websites. *Note: This issue only affected Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26954&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26954\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26954&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1657026\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;It was possible to cause the browser to enter fullscreen mode without displaying the security UI; thus making it possible to attempt a phishing attack or otherwise confuse the user. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26953&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26953\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26953&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1656741\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A parsing and event loading mismatch in Firefox's SVG code could have allowed load events to fire, even after sanitization. An attacker already capable of exploiting an XSS vulnerability in privileged internal pages could have used this attack to bypass our built-in sanitizer. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26951&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26951\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26951&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1667113\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;During browser shutdown, reference decrementing could have occured on a previously freed object, resulting in a use-after-free, memory corruption, and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83, Firefox ESR &amp;lt; 78.5, and Thunderbird &amp;lt; 78.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26959&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26959\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26959&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1669466\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-51/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-52/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;When listening for page changes with a Mutation Observer, a malicious web page could confuse Firefox Screenshots into interacting with elements other than those that it injected into the page. This would lead to internal errors and unexpected behavior in the Screenshots code. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26967&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26967\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26967&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1665820\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mozilla -- firefox&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;If the Remote Debugging via USB feature was enabled in Firefox for Android on an Android version prior to Android 6.0, untrusted apps could have connected to the feature and operated with the privileges of the browser to read and interact with web content. The feature was implemented as a unix domain socket, protected by the Android SELinux policy; however, SELinux was not enforced for versions prior to 6.0. This was fixed by removing the Remote Debugging via USB feature from affected devices. *Note: This issue only affected Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox &amp;lt; 83.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26964&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26964\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26964&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1658865\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2020-50/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;omniauth-apple_project -- omniauth-apple&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;omniauth-apple is the OmniAuth strategy for \"Sign In with Apple\" (RubyGem omniauth-apple). In omniauth-apple before version 1.0.1 attackers can fake their email address during authentication. This vulnerability impacts applications using the omniauth-apple strategy of OmniAuth and using the info.email field of OmniAuth's Auth Hash Schema for any kind of identification. The value of this field may be set to any value of the attacker's choice including email addresses of other users. Applications not using info.email for identification but are instead using the uid field are not impacted in the same manner. Note, these applications may still be negatively affected if the value of info.email is being used for other purposes. Applications using affected versions of omniauth-apple are advised to upgrade to omniauth-apple version 1.0.1 or later.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26254&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26254\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26254&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/nhosoya/omniauth-apple/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#101---2020-12-03\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/nhosoya/omniauth-apple/commit/b37d5409213adae2ca06a67fec14c8d3d07d9016\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/nhosoya/omniauth-apple/security/advisories/GHSA-49r3-2549-3633\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;online_examination_system_project -- online_examination_system&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Online Examination System 1.0 via the w parameter to index.php.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29258&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29258\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29258&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://asfiyashaikh20.medium.com/exploit-for-cve-2020-29258-reflected-cross-site-scripting-xss-vulnerability-957f365a1f3b\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;online_examination_system_project -- online_examination_system&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Online Examination System 1.0 via the q parameter to feedback.php.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29257&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29257\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29257&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://asfiyashaikh20.medium.com/exploit-for-cve-2020-29257-reflected-cross-site-scripting-xss-vulnerability-4a7bf9ae7d80\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;online_examination_system_project -- online_examination_system&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Online Examination System 1.0 via the subject or feedback parameter to feedback.php.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29259&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29259\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29259&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://asfiyashaikh20.medium.com/cve-2020-29259-persistent-xss-2ef63cc5cee6\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;openldap -- openldap&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A NULL pointer dereference was found in OpenLDAP server and was fixed in openldap 2.4.55, during a request for renaming RDNs. An unauthenticated attacker could remotely crash the slapd process by sending a specially crafted request, causing a Denial of Service.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25692&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25692\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25692&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894567\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;openssl -- openssl&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The X.509 GeneralName type is a generic type for representing different types of names. One of those name types is known as EDIPartyName. OpenSSL provides a function GENERAL_NAME_cmp which compares different instances of a GENERAL_NAME to see if they are equal or not. This function behaves incorrectly when both GENERAL_NAMEs contain an EDIPARTYNAME. A NULL pointer dereference and a crash may occur leading to a possible denial of service attack. OpenSSL itself uses the GENERAL_NAME_cmp function for two purposes: 1) Comparing CRL distribution point names between an available CRL and a CRL distribution point embedded in an X509 certificate 2) When verifying that a timestamp response token signer matches the timestamp authority name (exposed via the API functions TS_RESP_verify_response and TS_RESP_verify_token) If an attacker can control both items being compared then that attacker could trigger a crash. For example if the attacker can trick a client or server into checking a malicious certificate against a malicious CRL then this may occur. Note that some applications automatically download CRLs based on a URL embedded in a certificate. This checking happens prior to the signatures on the certificate and CRL being verified. OpenSSL's s_server, s_client and verify tools have support for the \"-crl_download\" option which implements automatic CRL downloading and this attack has been demonstrated to work against those tools. Note that an unrelated bug means that affected versions of OpenSSL cannot parse or construct correct encodings of EDIPARTYNAME. However it is possible to construct a malformed EDIPARTYNAME that OpenSSL's parser will accept and hence trigger this attack. All OpenSSL 1.1.1 and 1.0.2 versions are affected by this issue. Other OpenSSL releases are out of support and have not been checked. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1i (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2x (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2w).&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-1971&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-1971\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-1971&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=2154ab83e14ede338d2ede9bbe5cdfce5d5a6c9e\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=f960d81215ebf3f65e03d4d5d857fb9b666d6920\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-20:33.openssl.asc\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;FREEBSD&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4807\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20201208.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;openstack -- horizon&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in OpenStack Horizon before 15.3.2, 16.x before 16.2.1, 17.x and 18.x before 18.3.3, 18.4.x, and 18.5.x. There is a lack of validation of the \"next\" parameter, which would allow someone to supply a malicious URL in Horizon that can cause an automatic redirect to the provided malicious URL.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29565&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29565\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29565&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/08/2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1865026\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/758841/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/758843/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://security.openstack.org/ossa/OSSA-2020-008.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;os4ed -- opensis&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;OpenSIS Community Edition before 7.5 is affected by a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in SideForStudent.php via the modname parameter.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27408&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27408\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27408&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/OS4ED/openSIS-Responsive-Design/releases\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://insinuator.net/2020/10/opensis-vulnerabilities/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;plummac -- ik-401_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An improper webserver configuration on Plum IK-401 devices with firmware before 1.02 allows an attacker (with network access to the device) to obtain the configuration file, including hashed credential data. Successful exploitation could allow access to hashed credential data with a single unauthenticated GET request.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28946&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28946\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28946&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://plummac.com/project/ik-401/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.cert.pl/news/single/coraz-wiecej-urzadzen-przemyslowych-podlaczonych-do-internetu/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;processmaker -- processmaker&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SQL injection vulnerability exists in the handling of sort parameters in ProcessMaker 3.4.11. A specially crafted HTTP request can cause an SQL injection. The reportTables_Ajax and clientSetupAjax pages are vulnerable to SQL injection in the sort parameter.An attacker can make an authenticated HTTP request to trigger these vulnerabilities.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-13526&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13526\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13526&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1126\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pytest -- py&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A denial of service via regular expression in the py.path.svnwc component of py (aka python-py) through 1.9.0 could be used by attackers to cause a compute-time denial of service attack by supplying malicious input to the blame functionality.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; QANP have already fixed this vulnerability in Multimedia Console 1.1.5 and later.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2493&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2493\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2493&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-14\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- music_station&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This cross-site scripting vulnerability in Music Station allows remote attackers to inject malicious code. QTS 4.5.1: Photo Station 6.0.12 and later QTS 4.4.3: Photo Station 6.0.12 and later QTS 4.3.6: Photo Station 5.7.12 and later QTS 4.3.4: Photo Station 5.7.13 and later QTS 4.3.3: Photo Station 5.4.10 and later QTS 4.2.6: Photo Station 5.2.11 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2491&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2491\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2491&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-15\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- quts_hero&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;If exploited, this cross-site scripting vulnerability could allow remote attackers to inject malicious code in File Station. QANP have already fixed these vulnerabilities in the following versions of QTS and QuTS hero. QuTS hero h4.5.1.1472 build 20201031 and later QTS 4.5.1.1456 build 20201015 and later QTS 4.4.3.1354 build 20200702 and later QTS 4.3.6.1333 build 20200608 and later QTS 4.3.4.1368 build 20200703 and later QTS 4.3.3.1315 build 20200611 and later QTS 4.2.6 build 20200611 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2496&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2496\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2496&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-12\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- quts_hero&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;If exploited, this cross-site scripting vulnerability could allow remote attackers to inject malicious code in System Connection Logs. QANP have already fixed these vulnerabilities in the following versions of QTS and QuTS hero. QuTS hero h4.5.1.1472 build 20201031 and later QTS 4.5.1.1456 build 20201015 and later QTS 4.4.3.1354 build 20200702 and later QTS 4.3.6.1333 build 20200608 and later QTS 4.3.4.1368 build 20200703 and later QTS 4.3.3.1315 build 20200611 and later QTS 4.2.6 build 20200611 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2497&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2497\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2497&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-12\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- quts_hero&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;If exploited, this cross-site scripting vulnerability could allow remote attackers to inject malicious code in certificate configuration. QANP have already fixed these vulnerabilities in the following versions of QTS and QuTS hero. QuTS hero h4.5.1.1472 build 20201031 and later QTS 4.5.1.1456 build 20201015 and later QTS 4.4.3.1354 build 20200702 and later QTS 4.3.6.1333 build 20200608 and later QTS 4.3.4.1368 build 20200703 and later QTS 4.3.3.1315 build 20200611 and later QTS 4.2.6 build 20200611 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2498&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2498\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2498&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-12\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- quts_hero&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;If exploited, this cross-site scripting vulnerability could allow remote attackers to inject malicious code in File Station. QANP have already fixed these vulnerabilities in the following versions of QTS and QuTS hero. QuTS hero h4.5.1.1472 build 20201031 and later QTS 4.5.1.1456 build 20201015 and later QTS 4.4.3.1354 build 20200702 and later QTS 4.3.6.1333 build 20200608 and later QTS 4.3.4.1368 build 20200703 and later QTS 4.3.3.1315 build 20200611 and later QTS 4.2.6 build 20200611 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2495&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2495\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2495&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-12\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;react-adal_project -- react-adal&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects all versions of package react-adal. It is possible for a specially crafted JWT token and request URL can cause the nonce, session and refresh values to be incorrectly validated, causing the application to treat an attacker-generated JWT token as authentic. The logical defect is caused by how the nonce, session and refresh values are stored in the browser local storage or session storage. Each key is automatically appended by ||. When the received nonce and session keys are generated, the list of values is stored in the browser storage, separated by ||, with || always appended to the end of the list. Since || will always be the last 2 characters of the stored values, an empty string (\"\") will always be in the list of the valid values. Therefore, if an empty session parameter is provided in the callback URL, and a specially-crafted JWT token contains an nonce value of \"\" (empty string), then adal.js will consider the JWT token as authentic.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-7787&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7787\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7787&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/salvoravida/react-adal/pull/115\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-REACTADAL-1018907\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sap -- businessobjects_business_intelligence_platform&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SAP BusinessObjects BI Platform (Crystal Report), versions - 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, does not sufficiently validate uploaded XML entities during crystal report generation due to missing XML validation, An attacker with basic privileges can inject some arbitrary XML entities leading to internal file disclosure, internal directories disclosure, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and denial-of-service (DoS).&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26831&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26831\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26831&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/2989075\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wiki.scn.sap.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=564757079\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sap -- disclosure_management&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SAP Disclosure Management, version - 10.1, provides capabilities for authorized users to upload and download content of specific file type. In some file types it is possible to enter formulas which can call external applications or execute scripts. The execution of a payload (script) on target machine could be used to steal and modify the data available in the spreadsheet&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26828&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26828\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26828&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/2971180\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wiki.scn.sap.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=564757079\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sap -- hana_database&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SAP HANA Database, version - 2.0, does not correctly validate the username when performing SAML bearer token-based user authentication. It is possible to manipulate a valid existing SAML bearer token to authenticate as a user whose name is identical to the truncated username for whom the SAML bearer token was issued.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; Due to inadequate access control, a network attacker authenticated as a regular user can use operations which should be restricted to administrators. These operations can be used to Change the User Experience Monitoring configuration, obtain details about the configured SAP Solution Manager agents, Deploy a malicious User Experience Monitoring script.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28727&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28727\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28727&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://seeddms.com\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceforge.net/p/seeddms/code/ci/32b03b1e5880e2f38cecf4ac7743f8f62f33043f/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceforge.net/projects/seeddms/files/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;snapcraft_project -- snapcraft&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In some conditions, a snap package built by snapcraft includes the current directory in LD_LIBRARY_PATH, allowing a malicious snap to gain code execution within the context of another snap if both plug the home interface or similar. This issue affects snapcraft versions prior to 4.4.4, prior to 2.43.1+16.04.1, and prior to 2.43.1+18.04.1.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27348&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27348\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27348&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1901572\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/snapcore/snapcraft/pull/3345\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4661-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;systransoft -- pure_neural_server&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;API calls in the Translation API feature in Systran Pure Neural Server before 9.7.0 allow a threat actor to use the Systran Pure Neural Server as a Denial-of-Service proxy by sending a large amount of translation requests to a destination host on any given TCP port regardless of whether a web service is running on the destination port.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29540&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29540\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29540&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://grave-rose.medium.com/two-systran-vulnerabilities-and-their-exploits-8bc83ba29e14\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.systransoft.com/translation-products/systran-pure-neural-server/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;txjia -- imcat&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imcat 5.2 allows an authenticated file upload and consequently remote code execution via the picture functionality.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-23520&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-23520\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-23520&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/peacexie/imcat/issues/4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;zx2c4 -- password-store&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pass through 1.7.3 has a possibility of using a password for an unintended resource. For exploitation to occur, the user must do a git pull, decrypt a password, and log into a remote service with the password. If an attacker controls the central Git server or one of the other members' machines, and also controls one of the services already in the password store, they can rename one of the password files in the Git repository to something else: pass doesn't correctly verify that the content of a file matches the filename, so a user might be tricked into decrypting the wrong password and sending that to a service that the attacker controls. NOTE: for environments in which this threat model is of concern, signing commits can be a solution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28086&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28086\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28086&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.zx2c4.com/pipermail/password-store/2014-March/000498.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/tbody&gt;\n&lt;/table&gt;\n&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov#top\"&gt;Back to top&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a name=\"low\"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n\n&lt;div id=\"low_v\"&gt;\n&lt;h2 id=\"low_v_title\"&gt;Low Vulnerabilities&lt;/h2&gt;\n\n&lt;table align=\"center\" border=\"1\" style=\"table-layout: fixed; width: 100%;\" summary=\"Low Vulnerabilities\"&gt;\n\t&lt;thead&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"col\" style=\"width:24%;\"&gt;Primary&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\tVendor -- Product&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:44%;\"&gt;Description&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:10%;\"&gt;Published&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:8%;\"&gt;CVSS Score&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:14%;\"&gt;Source &amp;amp; Patch Info&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/thead&gt;\n\t&lt;tbody&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adobe -- lightroom&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Adobe Lightroom Classic version 10.0 (and earlier) for Windows is affected by an uncontrolled search path vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-24447&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.7&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24447\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24447&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/lightroom/apsb20-74.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adobe -- prelude&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Adobe Prelude version 9.0.1 (and earlier) is affected by an uncontrolled search path element that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-24440&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.7&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24440\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24440&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/prelude/apsb20-70.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apache -- groovy&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Apache Groovy provides extension methods to aid with creating temporary directories. Prior to this fix, Groovy's implementation of those extension methods was using a now superseded Java JDK method call that is potentially not secure on some operating systems in some contexts. Users not using the extension methods mentioned in the advisory are not affected, but may wish to read the advisory for further details. Versions Affected: 2.0 to 2.4.20, 2.5.0 to 2.5.13, 3.0.0 to 3.0.6, and 4.0.0-alpha-1. Fixed in versions 2.4.21, 2.5.14, 3.0.7, 4.0.0-alpha-2.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17521&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17521\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17521&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://groovy-lang.org/security.html#CVE-2020-17521\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ra9dab34bf8625511f23692ad0fcee2725f782e9aad6c5cdff6cf4465@%3Cnotifications.groovy.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apereo -- opencast&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Opencast before versions 8.9 and 7.9 disables HTTPS hostname verification of its HTTP client used for a large portion of Opencast's HTTP requests. Hostname verification is an important part when using HTTPS to ensure that the presented certificate is valid for the host. Disabling it can allow for man-in-the-middle attacks. This problem is fixed in Opencast 7.9 and Opencast 8.8 Please be aware that fixing the problem means that Opencast will not simply accept any self-signed certificates any longer without properly importing them. If you need those, please make sure to import them into the Java key store. Better yet, get a valid certificate.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26234&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26234\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/opencast/opencast/commit/4225bf90af74557deaf8fb6b80b0705c9621acfc\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/opencast/opencast/security/advisories/GHSA-44cw-p2hm-gpf6\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- icloud&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, watchOS 7.1, iOS 14.2 and iPadOS 14.2, iCloud for Windows 11.5, tvOS 14.2, iTunes 12.11 for Windows. A local user may be able to read arbitrary files.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-10002&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-10002\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-10002&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211928\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211929\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211930\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211933\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211935\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- ipad_os&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The issue was addressed with improved deletion. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, watchOS 7.0, iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0. A local user may be able to discover a users deleted messages.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-9989&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-9989\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-9989&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211844\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211850\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- ipad_os&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The issue was addressed with improved deletion. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0. A local user may be able to discover a users deleted messages.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-9988&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-9988\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-9988&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211850\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- ipad_os&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An access issue was addressed with additional sandbox restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1, watchOS 7.0, tvOS 14.0, iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0. A local user may be able to view senstive user information.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-9969&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;1.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-9969\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-9969&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211843\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211844\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211850\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- ipados&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.2 and iPadOS 14.2. A person with physical access to an iOS device may be able to access stored passwords without authentication.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27902&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27902\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27902&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211929\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- ipados&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue existed in the handling of incoming calls. The issue was addressed with additional state checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.2 and iPadOS 14.2. A user may answer two calls simultaneously without indication they have answered a second call.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27925&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;1.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27925\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27925&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211929\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apple -- mac_os_x&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.0.1. A malicious application may be able to determine kernel memory layout.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-10007&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-10007\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-10007&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;arachnys -- cabot&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Arachnys Cabot 0.11.12 can be exploited via the Address column.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25449&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25449\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25449&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://itsmeanonartist.tech/blogs/blog2.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159070/Cabot-0.11.12-Cross-Site-Scripting.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploitalert.com/view-details.html?id=36106\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/48791\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;c2fo -- fast-csv&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Fast-csv is an npm package for parsing and formatting CSVs or any other delimited value file in node. In fast-cvs before version 4.3.6 there is a possible ReDoS vulnerability (Regular Expression Denial of Service) when using ignoreEmpty option when parsing. This has been patched in `v4.3.6` You will only be affected by this if you use the `ignoreEmpty` parsing option.
