If you do use this option it is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version `v4.3.6` This vulnerability was found using a CodeQL query which identified `EMPTY_ROW_REGEXP` regular expression as vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26256&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26256\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26256&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/C2FO/fast-csv/commit/4bbd39f26a8cd7382151ab4f5fb102234b2f829e\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/C2FO/fast-csv/issues/540\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/C2FO/fast-csv/security/advisories/GHSA-8cv5-p934-3hwp\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lgtm.com/query/8609731774537641779/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@fast-csv/parse\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.npmjs.com/package/fast-csv\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;canonical -- ubuntu_linux&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Aptdaemon performed policykit checks after interacting with potentially untrusted files with elevated privileges. This affected versions prior to 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu34.1, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu19.5, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27349&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27349\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27349&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apt/+bug/1899193\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4664-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;canonical -- ubuntu_linux&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An Ubuntu-specific patch in PulseAudio created a race condition where the snap policy module would fail to identify a client connection from a snap as coming from a snap if SCM_CREDENTIALS were missing, allowing the snap to connect to PulseAudio without proper confinement. This could be exploited by an attacker to expose sensitive information. Fixed in 1:13.99.3-1ubuntu2, 1:13.99.2-1ubuntu2.1, 1:13.99.1-1ubuntu3.8, 1:11.1-1ubuntu7.11, and 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.15.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16123&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16123\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16123&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://launchpad.net/bugs/1895928\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;UBUNTU&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://ubuntu.com/USN-4640-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;UBUNTU&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;canonical -- ubuntu_linux&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The aptdaemon DBus interface disclosed file existence disclosure by setting Terminal/DebconfSocket properties, aka GHSL-2020-192 and GHSL-2020-196. This affected versions prior to 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu34.1, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu19.5, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16128&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16128&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/aptdaemon/+bug/1899513\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4664-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ceph -- ceph-ansible&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Ceph-ansible 4.0.34.1 creates /etc/ceph/iscsi-gateway.conf with insecure default permissions, allowing any user to read the sensitive information within.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25677&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25677\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25677&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1892108\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/5964\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;cogboard -- red-dashboard&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Red Discord Bot Dashboard is an easy-to-use interactive web dashboard to control your Redbot. In Red Discord Bot before version 0.1.7a an RCE exploit has been discovered. This exploit allows Discord users with specially crafted Server names and Usernames/Nicknames to inject code into the webserver front-end code. By abusing this exploit, it's possible to perform destructive actions and/or access sensitive information. This high severity exploit has been fixed on version 0.1.7a. There are no workarounds, bot owners must upgrade their relevant packages (Dashboard module and Dashboard webserver) in order to patch this issue.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26249&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26249\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26249&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/Cog-Creators/Red-Dashboard/commit/99d88b840674674166ce005b784ae8e31e955ab1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/Cog-Creators/Red-Dashboard/commit/a6b9785338003ec87fb75305e7d1cc2d40c7ab91\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/Cog-Creators/Red-Dashboard/security/advisories/GHSA-hm45-mgqm-gjm4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://pypi.org/project/Red-Dashboard\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gitlab -- gitlab&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A XSS vulnerability exists in Gitlab CE/EE from 12.4 before 13.4.7, 13.5 before 13.5.5, and 13.6 before 13.6.2 that allows an attacker to perform cross-site scripting to other users via importing a malicious project&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26407&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26407\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26407&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2020/CVE-2020-26407.json\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/212630\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://hackerone.com/reports/832117\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;igniterealtime -- openfire&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Ignite Realtime Openfire 4.6.0 has plugins/bookmarks/create-bookmark.jsp Stored XSS.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35127&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35127\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35127&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://discourse.igniterealtime.org/t/openfire-4-6-0-has-stored-xss-vulnerabilities/89276\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;jupyterhub -- systemdspawner&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;jupyterhub-systemdspawner enables JupyterHub to spawn single-user notebook servers using systemd. In jupyterhub-systemdspawner before version 0.15 user API tokens issued to single-user servers are specified in the environment of systemd units. These tokens are incorrectly accessible to all users. In particular, the-littlest-jupyterhub is affected, which uses systemdspawner by default. This is patched in jupyterhub-systemdspawner v0.15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26261&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26261\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26261&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jupyterhub/systemdspawner/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v015\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jupyterhub/systemdspawner/commit/a4d08fd2ade1cfd0ef2c29dc221e649345f23580\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jupyterhub/systemdspawner/security/advisories/GHSA-cg54-gpgr-4rm6\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://pypi.org/project/jupyterhub-systemdspawner/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kubernetes -- kubernetes&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Kubernetes, if the logging level is set to at least 9, authorization and bearer tokens will be written to log files. This can occur both in API server logs and client tool output like kubectl. This affects &amp;lt;= v1.19.3, &amp;lt;= v1.18.10, &amp;lt;= v1.17.13, &amp;lt; v1.20.0-alpha2.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8565&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8565\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8565&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95623\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-discuss/c/vm-HcrFUOCs/m/36utxAM5CwAJ\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kubernetes -- kubernetes&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Kubernetes clusters using a logging level of at least 4, processing a malformed docker config file will result in the contents of the docker config file being leaked, which can include pull secrets or other registry credentials. This affects &amp;lt; v1.19.3, &amp;lt; v1.18.10, &amp;lt; v1.17.13.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8564&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8564\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8564&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95622\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-discuss/c/vm-HcrFUOCs/m/36utxAM5CwAJ\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kubernetes -- kubernetes&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Kubernetes clusters using VSphere as a cloud provider, with a logging level set to 4 or above, VSphere cloud credentials will be leaked in the cloud controller manager's log. This affects &amp;lt; v1.19.3.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8563&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8563\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8563&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95621\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-discuss/c/vm-HcrFUOCs/m/36utxAM5CwAJ\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kubernetes -- kubernetes&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Kubernetes clusters using Ceph RBD as a storage provisioner, with logging level of at least 4, Ceph RBD admin secrets can be written to logs. This occurs in kube-controller-manager's logs during provisioning of Ceph RBD persistent claims. This affects &amp;lt; v1.19.3, &amp;lt; v1.18.10, &amp;lt; v1.17.13.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8566&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8566\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8566&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95624\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-discuss/c/vm-HcrFUOCs/m/36utxAM5CwAJ\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- 365_apps&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Microsoft Excel Information Disclosure Vulnerability'.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17126&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17126\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17126&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17126\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- dynamics_365&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Dynamics CRM Webclient Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability'.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17147&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17147\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17147&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17147\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- git_credential_manager_core&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Git Credential Manager Core (GCM Core) is a secure Git credential helper built on .NET Core that runs on Windows and macOS. In Git Credential Manager Core before version 2.0.289, when recursively cloning a Git repository on Windows with submodules, Git will first clone the top-level repository and then recursively clone all submodules by starting new Git processes from the top-level working directory. If a malicious git.exe executable is present in the top-level repository then this binary will be started by Git Credential Manager Core when attempting to read configuration, and not git.exe as found on the %PATH%. This only affects GCM Core on Windows, not macOS or Linux-based distributions. GCM Core version 2.0.289 contains the fix for this vulnerability, and is available from the project's GitHub releases page. GCM Core 2.0.289 is also bundled in the latest Git for Windows release; version 2.29.2(3). As a workaround, users should avoid recursively cloning untrusted repositories with the --recurse-submodules option.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26233&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.6&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26233\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26233&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/microsoft/Git-Credential-Manager-Core/commit/61c0388e064babb3b4e60d3ec269e8a07ab3bc76\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/microsoft/Git-Credential-Manager-Core/releases/tag/v2.0.289-beta\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/microsoft/Git-Credential-Manager-Core/security/advisories/GHSA-2gq7-ww4j-3m76\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone#Documentation/git-clone.txt---recurse-submodulesltpathspecgt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- teams&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The Microsoft Teams online service contains a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the displayName parameter that can be exploited on Teams clients to obtain sensitive information such as authentication tokens and to possibly execute arbitrary commands. This vulnerability was fixed for all Teams users in the online service on or around October 2020.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-10146&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-10146\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-10146&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/oskarsve/ms-teams-rce\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- windows_10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Windows Error Reporting Information Disclosure Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2020-17138.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17094&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17094\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17094&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17094\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- windows_10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Windows Error Reporting Information Disclosure Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2020-17094.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17138&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17138\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17138&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17138\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- windows_10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Windows GDI+ Information Disclosure Vulnerability'.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17098&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17098\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17098&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17098\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nlnetlabs -- name_server_daemon&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;NLnet Labs Unbound, up to and including version 1.12.0, and NLnet Labs NSD, up to and including version 4.3.3, contain a local vulnerability that would allow for a local symlink attack. When writing the PID file, Unbound and NSD create the file if it is not there, or open an existing file for writing. In case the file was already present, they would follow symlinks if the file happened to be a symlink instead of a regular file. An additional chown of the file would then take place after it was written, making the user Unbound/NSD is supposed to run as the new owner of the file. If an attacker has local access to the user Unbound/NSD runs as, she could create a symlink in place of the PID file pointing to a file that she would like to erase. If then Unbound/NSD is killed and the PID file is not cleared, upon restarting with root privileges, Unbound/NSD will rewrite any file pointed at by the symlink. This is a local vulnerability that could create a Denial of Service of the system Unbound/NSD is running on. It requires an attacker having access to the limited permission user Unbound/NSD runs as and point through the symlink to a critical file on the system.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28935&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28935\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28935&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/downloads/nsd/CVE-2020-28935.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/downloads/unbound/CVE-2020-28935.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;paloaltonetworks -- cortex_xdr_agent&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An improper handling of exceptional conditions vulnerability in Cortex XDR Agent allows a local authenticated Windows user to create files in the software's internal program directory that prevents the Cortex XDR Agent from starting. The exceptional condition is persistent and prevents Cortex XDR Agent from starting when the software or machine is restarted. This issue impacts: Cortex XDR Agent 5.0 versions earlier than 5.0.10; Cortex XDR Agent 6.1 versions earlier than 6.1.7; Cortex XDR Agent 7.0 versions earlier than 7.0.3; Cortex XDR Agent 7.1 versions earlier than 7.1.2.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-2020&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2020\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2020&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2020-2020\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;phpldapadmin_project -- phpldapadmin&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An XSS issue has been discovered in phpLDAPadmin before 1.2.6.2 that allows users to store malicious values that may be executed by other users at a later time via get_request in lib/function.php.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35132&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35132\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35132&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/phpldapadmin/+bug/1906474\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/leenooks/phpLDAPadmin/commit/c87571f6b7be15d5cd8b26381b6eb31ad03d28e2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/leenooks/phpLDAPadmin/compare/1.2.5...1.2.6.2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/leenooks/phpLDAPadmin/issues/130\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qemu -- qemu&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in the memory management API of QEMU during the initialization of a memory region cache. This issue could lead to an out-of-bounds write access to the MSI-X table while performing MMIO operations. A guest user may abuse this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service. This flaw affects QEMU versions prior to 5.2.0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27821&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27821\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27821&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1902651\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sap -- netweaver_application_server_java&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SAP AS JAVA (Key Storage Service), versions - 7.10, 7.11, 7.20 ,7.30, 7.31, 7.40, 7.50, has the key material which is stored in the SAP NetWeaver AS Java Key Storage service stored in the database in the DER encoded format and is not encrypted. This enables an attacker who has administrator access to the SAP NetWeaver AS Java to decode the keys because of missing encryption and get some application data and client credentials of adjacent systems. This highly impacts Confidentiality as information disclosed could contain client credentials of adjacent systems.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26816&amp;amp;vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.7&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26816\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26816&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/2971163\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wiki.scn.sap.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=564757079\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;student_management_system_project_in_php_project -- student_management_system_project_in_php&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;SourceCodester Student Management System Project in PHP version 1.0 is vulnerable to stored a cross-site scripting (XSS) via the 'add subject' tab.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25955&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25955\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25955&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/160398/Student-Management-System-Project-PHP-1.0-Cross-Site-Scripting.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;FULLDISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.sourcecodester.com/php/14443/student-management-system-project-php.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;systransoft -- pure_neural_server&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) issue in WebUI Translation in Systran Pure Neural Server before 9.7.0 allows a threat actor to have a remote authenticated user run JavaScript from a malicious site.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29539&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29539\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29539&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://grave-rose.medium.com/two-systran-vulnerabilities-and-their-exploits-8bc83ba29e14\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.systransoft.com/translation-products/systran-pure-neural-server/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/tbody&gt;\n&lt;/table&gt;\n&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov#top\"&gt;Back to top&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a name=\"severity_not_yet_assigned\"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n\n&lt;div id=\"snya_v\"&gt;\n&lt;h2 id=\"snya_v_title\"&gt;Severity Not Yet Assigned&lt;/h2&gt;\n\n&lt;table align=\"center\" border=\"1\" id=\"table_severity_not_yet_assigned\" style=\"table-layout: fixed; width: 100%;\" summary=\"Severity Not Yet Assigned\"&gt;\n\t&lt;thead&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"col\" style=\"width:24%;\"&gt;Primary&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\tVendor -- Product&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:44%;\"&gt;Description&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:10%;\"&gt;Published&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:8%;\"&gt;CVSS Score&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:14%;\"&gt;Source &amp;amp; Patch Info&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/thead&gt;\n\t&lt;tbody&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adobe -- adobe_experience_manager&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;AEM Forms SP6 add-on for AEM 6.5.6.0 and Forms add-on package for AEM 6.4 Service Pack 8 Cumulative Fix Pack 2 (6.4.8.2) have a blind Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability. This vulnerability could be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker to gather information about internal systems that reside on the same network.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24444\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24444&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/experience-manager/apsb20-72.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adobe -- adobe_experience_manager&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;AEM's Cloud Service offering, as well as versions 6.5.6.0 (and below), 6.4.8.2 (and below) and 6.3.3.8 (and below) are affected by a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability that could be abused by an attacker to inject malicious scripts into vulnerable form fields. Malicious JavaScript may be executed in a victims browser when they browse to the page containing the vulnerable field.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24445\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24445&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/experience-manager/apsb20-72.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apache -- airflow&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The \"origin\" parameter passed to some of the endpoints like '/trigger' was vulnerable to XSS exploit. This issue affects Apache Airflow versions prior to 1.10.13. This is same as CVE-2020-13944 but the implemented fix in Airflow 1.10.13 did not fix the issue completely.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17515\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17515&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/11/2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r2892ef594dbbf54d0939b808626f52f7c2d1584f8aa1d81570847d2a@%3Cannounce.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r2892ef594dbbf54d0939b808626f52f7c2d1584f8aa1d81570847d2a@%3Cdev.airflow.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r2892ef594dbbf54d0939b808626f52f7c2d1584f8aa1d81570847d2a@%3Cusers.airflow.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r4656959c8ed06c1f6202d89aa4e67b35ad7bdba5a666caff3fea888e%40%3Cusers.airflow.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r4656959c8ed06c1f6202d89aa4e67b35ad7bdba5a666caff3fea888e@%3Cusers.airflow.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apache -- nuttx&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in TCP stack of Apache NuttX (incubating) versions up to and including 9.1.0 and 10.0.0 allows attacker to corrupt memory by supplying arbitrary urgent data pointer offsets within TCP packets including beyond the length of the packet.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17528\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17528&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/09/4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7f4215aba288660b41b7e731b6262c8275fa476e91e527a74d2888ea%40%3Cdev.nuttx.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7f4215aba288660b41b7e731b6262c8275fa476e91e527a74d2888ea@%3Cdev.nuttx.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apache -- nuttx&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in TCP Stack of Apache NuttX (incubating) versions up to and including 9.1.0 and 10.0.0 allows attacker to corrupt memory by supplying and invalid fragmentation offset value specified in the IP header. This is only impacts builds with both CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL and CONFIG_NET_TCP_REASSEMBLY build flags enabled.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17529\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17529&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/09/5\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r4d71ae3ab96b589835b94ba7ac4cb88a704e7307bceefeab749366f3%40%3Cdev.nuttx.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r4d71ae3ab96b589835b94ba7ac4cb88a704e7307bceefeab749366f3@%3Cdev.nuttx.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apache -- struts&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Forced OGNL evaluation, when evaluated on raw user input in tag attributes, may lead to remote code execution. Affected software : Apache Struts 2.0.0 - Struts 2.5.25.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17530\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17530&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN43969166/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;JVN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-061\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apt -- apt&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;APT had several integer overflows and underflows while parsing .deb packages, aka GHSL-2020-168 GHSL-2020-169, in files apt-pkg/contrib/extracttar.cc, apt-pkg/deb/debfile.cc, and apt-pkg/contrib/arfile.cc. This issue affects: apt 1.2.32ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.2.32ubuntu0.2; 1.6.12ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.12ubuntu0.2; 2.0.2ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.2ubuntu0.2; 2.1.10ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.1.10ubuntu0.1;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27350\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27350&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1899193\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4667-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;UBUNTU&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4808\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;apt-python -- apt-python&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Various memory and file descriptor leaks were found in apt-python files python/arfile.cc, python/tag.cc, python/tarfile.cc, aka GHSL-2020-170. This issue affects: python-apt 1.1.0~beta1 versions prior to 1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10; 1.6.5ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.5ubuntu0.4; 2.0.0ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.0ubuntu0.20.04.2; 2.1.3ubuntu1 versions prior to 2.1.3ubuntu1.1;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27351\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27351&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1899193\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4668-1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;UBUNTU&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4809\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;artifex_software -- mupdf_library&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Use After Free vulnerability exists in Artifex Software, Inc. MuPDF library 1.17.0-rc1 and earlier when a valid page was followed by a page with invalid pixmap dimensions, causing bander - a static - to point to previously freed memory instead of a newband_writer.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16600\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16600&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://git.ghostscript.com/?p=mupdf.git;h=96751b25462f83d6e16a9afaf8980b0c3f979c8b\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=702253\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;aruba_networks -- multiple_products&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An attacker is able to remotely inject arbitrary commands by sending especially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks AP Management protocol) UDP port (8211) of access-pointsor controllers in Aruba 9000 Gateway; Aruba 7000 Series Mobility Controllers; Aruba 7200 Series Mobility Controllers version(s): 2.1.0.1, 2.2.0.0 and below; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below ; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24634\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24634&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docLocale=en_US&amp;amp;docId=emr_na-hpesbnw04072en_us\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;aruba_networks -- multiple_products&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;There are multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending especially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks AP management protocol) UDP port (8211) of access-points or controllers in Aruba 9000 Gateway; Aruba 7000 Series Mobility Controllers; Aruba 7200 Series Mobility Controllers version(s): 2.1.0.1, 2.2.0.0 and below; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24633\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24633&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docLocale=en_US&amp;amp;docId=emr_na-hpesbnw04072en_us\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;aruba_networks -- multiple_products&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Two vulnerabilities in ArubaOS GRUB2 implementation allows for an attacker to bypass secureboot. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability this could lead to remote compromise of system integrity by allowing an attacker to load an untrusted or modified kernel in Aruba 9000 Gateway; Aruba 7000 Series Mobility Controllers; Aruba 7200 Series Mobility Controllers version(s): 2.1.0.1, 2.2.0.0 and below; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below ; 6.4.4.23, 6.5.4.17, 8.2.2.9, 8.3.0.13, 8.5.0.10, 8.6.0.5, 8.7.0.0 and below.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24637\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24637&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docLocale=en_US&amp;amp;docId=emr_na-hpesbnw04072en_us\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;askey -- ap5100w_d171_devices&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Askey AP5100W_Dual_SIG_1.01.097 and all prior versions use a weak password at the Operating System (rlx-linux) level. This allows an attacker to gain unauthorized access as an admin or root user to the device Operating System via Telnet or SSH.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26201\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26201&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.askey.com.tw/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.askey.com.tw/incident_report_notifications.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;askey -- ap5100w_d171_devices&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Askey AP5100W devices through AP5100W_Dual_SIG_1.01.097 are affected by WPS PIN offline brute-force cracking. This arises because of issues with the random number selection for the Diffie-Hellman exchange. By capturing an attempted (and even failed) WPS authentication attempt, it is possible to brute force the overall authentication exchange. This allows an attacker to obtain the recovered WPS PIN in minutes or even seconds, and eventually obtain the Wi-Fi PSK key, gaining access to the Wi=Fi network.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-15023\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-15023&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.askey.com.tw/incident_report_notifications.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.askey.com.tw/Products/wifi.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;askey -- ap5100w_d171_devices&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Network Analysis functionality in Askey AP5100W_Dual_SIG_1.01.097 and all prior versions allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a shell metacharacter in the ping, traceroute, or route options.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-15357\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-15357&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://starlabs.sg/advisories/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.askey.com.tw/incident_report_notifications.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;awstats -- awstats&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In AWStats through 7.8, cgi-bin/awstats.pl?config= accepts a partial absolute pathname (omitting the initial /etc), even though it was intended to only read a file in the /etc/awstats/awstats.conf format. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000501 and CVE-2020-29600.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35176\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35176&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/eldy/awstats/issues/195\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;broadcom -- symantec_messaging_gateway&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A privilege escalation flaw allows a malicious, authenticated, privileged CLI user to escalate their privileges on the system and gain full control over the SMG appliance. This affects SMG prior to 10.7.4.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-12594\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-12594&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.broadcom.com/security-advisory/content/security-advisories/Privilege-Escalation-and-Information-Disclosure-Vulnerabilities-in-SMG/SYMSA16609\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;broadcom -- symantec_messaging_gateway&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An information disclosure flaw allows a malicious, authenticated, privileged web UI user to obtain a password for a remote SCP backup server that they might not otherwise be authorized to access. This affects SMG prior to 10.7.4.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-12595\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-12595&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.broadcom.com/security-advisory/content/security-advisories/Privilege-Escalation-and-Information-Disclosure-Vulnerabilities-in-SMG/SYMSA16609\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;p&gt;brocade -- fabric_os&lt;/p&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Brocade Fabric OS versions before v9.0.0 and after version v8.1.0, configured in Virtual Fabric mode contain a weakness in the ldap implementation that could allow a remote ldap user to login in the Brocade Fibre Channel SAN switch with \"user\" privileges if it is not associated with any groups.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-15376\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-15376&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.broadcom.com/support/fibre-channel-networking/security-advisories/brocade-security-advisory-2020-1158\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;brocade -- fabric_os&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Brocade Fabric OS versions before v9.0.0, v8.2.2c, v8.2.1e, v8.1.2k, v8.2.0_CBN3, v7.4.2g contain an improper input validation weakness in the command line interface when secccrypptocfg is invoked. The vulnerability could allow a local authenticated user to run arbitrary commands and perform escalation of privileges.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-15375\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-15375&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.broadcom.com/support/fibre-channel-networking/security-advisories/brocade-security-advisory-2020-1083\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0. An Integer Overflow exists in the uIP TCP/IP Stack component when parsing TCP MSS options of IPv4 network packets in uip_process in net/ipv4/uip.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13988\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13988&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0. An Out-of-Bounds Read vulnerability exists in the uIP TCP/IP Stack component when calculating the checksums for IP packets in upper_layer_chksum in net/ipv4/uip.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13987\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13987&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in uIP 1.0, as used in Contiki 3.0 and other products. When the Urgent flag is set in a TCP packet, and the stack is configured to ignore the urgent data, the stack attempts to use the value of the Urgent pointer bytes to separate the Urgent data from the normal data, by calculating the offset at which the normal data should be present in the global buffer. However, the length of this offset is not checked; therefore, for large values of the Urgent pointer bytes, the data pointer can point to memory that is way beyond the data buffer in uip_process in uip.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17437\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17437&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0. An infinite loop exists in the uIP TCP/IP stack component when handling RPL extension headers of IPv6 network packets in rpl_remove_header in net/rpl/rpl-ext-header.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13986\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13986&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0. A memory corruption vulnerability exists in the uIP TCP/IP stack component when handling RPL extension headers of IPv6 network packets in rpl_remove_header in net/rpl/rpl-ext-header.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13985\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13985&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0. An infinite loop exists in the uIP TCP/IP stack component when processing IPv6 extension headers in ext_hdr_options_process in net/ipv6/uip6.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13984\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13984&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the IPv6 stack in Contiki through 3.0. There is an insufficient check for the IPv6 header length. This leads to Denial-of-Service and potential Remote Code Execution via a crafted ICMPv6 echo packet.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25111\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25111&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the IPv6 stack in Contiki through 3.0. There are inconsistent checks for IPv6 header extension lengths. This leads to Denial-of-Service and potential Remote Code Execution via a crafted ICMPv6 echo packet.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25112\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25112&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;contiki -- contiki_and_contiki-ng&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Contiki through 3.0 and Contiki-NG through 4.5. The code for parsing Type A domain name answers in ip64-dns64.c doesn't verify whether the address in the answer's length is sane. Therefore, when copying an address of an arbitrary length, a buffer overflow can occur. This bug can be exploited whenever NAT64 is enabled.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24336\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24336&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;corenlp-js-interface -- corenlp-js-interface&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;All versions of package corenlp-js-interface are vulnerable to Command Injection via the main function.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28440\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28440&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-CORENLPJSINTERFACE-1050435\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;corenlp-js-prefab -- corenlp-js-prefab&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects all versions of package corenlp-js-prefab. The injection point is located in line 10 in 'index.js.' It depends on a vulnerable package 'corenlp-js-interface.' Vulnerability can be exploited with the following PoC:&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28439\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28439&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-CORENLPJSPREFAB-1050434\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;dupscout -- dupscout_enterprise&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A buffer overflow in the web server of Flexense DupScout Enterprise 10.0.18 allows a remote anonymous attacker to execute code as SYSTEM by overflowing the sid parameter via a GET /settings&amp;amp;sid= attack.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29659\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29659&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.dupscout.com\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49217\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;eip_stack_group -- opener&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the Ethernet/IP server functionality of EIP Stack Group OpENer 2.3 and development commit 8c73bf3. A specially crafted series of network requests can lead to remote code execution. An attacker can send a sequence of requests to trigger this vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13556\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13556&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1170\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;eip_stack_group -- opener&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the Ethernet/IP server functionality of the EIP Stack Group OpENer 2.3 and development commit 8c73bf3. A large number of network requests in a small span of time can cause the running program to stop. An attacker can send a sequence of requests to trigger this vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13530\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13530&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1143\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;f5 -- big-ip&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;On BIG-IP 14.1.0-14.1.2.6, undisclosed endpoints in iControl REST allow for a reflected XSS attack, which could lead to a complete compromise of the BIG-IP system if the victim user is granted the admin role.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5950\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5950&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K42696541\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;f5 -- big-ip&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;On BIG-IP versions 14.0.0-14.0.1 and 13.1.0-13.1.3.4, certain traffic pattern sent to a virtual server configured with an FTP profile can cause the FTP channel to break.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5949\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5949&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K20984059\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;f5 -- big-ip&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;On BIG-IP versions 16.0.0-16.0.0.1, 15.1.0-15.1.0.5, 14.1.0-14.1.2.7, 13.1.0-13.1.3.4, 12.1.0-12.1.5.2, and 11.6.1-11.6.5.2, undisclosed endpoints in iControl REST allow for a reflected XSS attack, which could lead to a complete compromise of the BIG-IP system if the victim user is granted the admin role.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5948\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5948&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K42696541\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;f5 -- big-ip_afm&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In certain configurations on version 13.1.3.4, when a BIG-IP AFM HTTP security profile is applied to a virtual server and the BIG-IP system receives a request with specific characteristics, the connection is reset and the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) leaks memory.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27713\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27713&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K37960100\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;fastadmin -- fastadmin&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The member center function in fastadmin V1.0.0.20200506_beta is vulnerable to a Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25967\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25967&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.cnpanda.net/codeaudit/777.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;fnet -- fnet&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in FNET through 4.6.4. The code for processing the hostname from an LLMNR request doesn't check for '\\0' termination. Therefore, the deduced length of the hostname doesn't reflect the correct length of the actual data. This may lead to Information Disclosure in _fnet_llmnr_poll in fnet_llmnr.c during a response to a malicious request of the DNS class IN.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17467\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17467&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://fnet.sourceforge.net/manual/fnet_history.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;fnet -- fnet&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in FNET through 4.6.4. The code that initializes the DNS client interface structure does not set sufficiently random transaction IDs (they are always set to 1 in _fnet_dns_poll in fnet_dns.c).
